conversationHistory.botResponse:
Hello! I can help you with dal storage and waste reduction.

• Store cooked dal in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days.

• For dry dal, keep it in a cool, dark, and dry place, like a pantry, in an airtight container. This can extend its shelf life to 1-2 years.

• You can make dal paratha using leftover dal. The cost would be approximately 40 BDT for one person.

Reducing food waste helps lower greenhouse gas emissions from landfills in Bangladesh.

Next step: Check your dal supply and store it properly to prevent spoilage.

Hello! I'm happy to help you with nutrition advice tailored for you.

• Focus on incorporating more iron into your diet.

• Two budget-friendly options include:
    *  Spinach (Palak): Approximately 20 BDT per bundle.
    *  Lentils (Dal): Approximately 80 BDT per kg.

Iron is essential for energy levels and overall health.

Next step: Try adding spinach to your next dal dish to boost your iron intake affordably.
